speaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series
text: Joe Keenan, Christopher Lloyd, Rob Greenberg, Jack Burditt, Chuck Ranberg, Anne Flett- Giordano, Linda Morris, Vic Rauseo  ENTERTAINMENT WEEKLY    *  **Reader's Favorites: 1ST**  * * *  ## Transcript {shawne wang}     _ACT ONE Scene One - KACL Frasier's on air at KACL and he's running out of time.  But Roz still hands him over to his next caller._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we've got about thirty seconds.  I think we've got time for one quick call. [_presses button_] Hello, Marlene, I'm listening.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Marlene
text: [_v.o._] Oh my God, I'm really on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, your problem, please...

speaker: Marlene
text: [_dog barking_] Lucky, Lucky, get down.  George, get the dog! [_Roz points urgently at the clock_] Oh my God, this is so exciting! [_baby crying_] Honey, honey, get the baby.  George, get your son!  OK, OK, here it is, Dr. Crane: if my husband and I don't find some time to have sex soon, I think I'm gonna burst.  I may even have to go to a department store and pick up a stranger. [_man calling "Hello!"_] Oh, kids!  Look who's here without calling first, Nana and Pop Pop! [_sighs_] I'll call you back. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, to all you Marlenes out there, may I suggest that sex with a stranger is not the answer.  Why don't you just pack the kids off with Nana and Pop Pop, lock Lucky downstairs in the basement, grab your husband, take him to the sturdiest kitchen table you have, and let the postman ring twice!  Now, to the rest of my listeners, I'll be off on vacation for the next week, so please tune in to my replacement, the noted podiatrist, Dr Garreth Wooten, who'll be discussing the virtues of his new book, "Bunions and Blisters and Corns," Oh My!

speaker: Roz
text: I hate it when that weird foot freak subs for you. Couldn't you just have Frederick come and visit you here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry Roz, the taxi's waiting outside to take me to the airport.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh well, have a great time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thanks. [_hugs Roz_]

speaker: Roz
text: And don't forget to bring me a present!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll get you a nice T-shirt from Colonial Williamsburg.

speaker: Roz
text: You're taking Frederick to Williamsburg?  Eeew!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's a wonderful vacation spot!  We're going to dip candles, tan leather, churn butter...

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frederick Crane, you just finished the first grade, what are you going to do now? [_with wide-eyed innocence_] I'm going to Butterworld!  _Frasier makes a face and leaves.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Martin is reading the paper in his Armchair and gets an idea when Daphne comes in with the laundry._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Daphne, bring that laundry over here, will you?

speaker: Daphne
text: What for?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I was just reading about an intelligence test you can give your dog.  You throw a towel over its head and see how long it takes him to shake it off. [_calling_] Eddie!  _Eddie scampers in.  As Daphne watches with amusement, Martin takes a small dish towel and throws it over his head._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, and the faster he takes the towel off, the smarter he is?

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic_] No, the faster he folds it.  All right, they ranked all the dogs and the smartest was a border collie; he did it in seven seconds. [_starts timing_] All right, come on boy, take it off. [_Eddie doesn't move_] Six... seven.  OK, the next fastest one was a poodle, I know he's as smart as a poodle. [_counts off on his watch_] OK, so he's no poodle... he's not a beagle either... or a German shepherd... or a Labrador.  Oh, for God's sake, Eddie!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, well, if you ask me, he's refusing to do that trick because he knows if he does it right, you'll have him doing it every time we have company.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I'll bet you're right! [_takes the towel off and shakes a finger at Eddie_] Nice going, Eddie!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: I appreciate the false cheer, Daphne.  But I'm sure you've seen this? [_holds up newspaper_] Today's society page?

speaker: Martin
text: [_covering his ears_] Don't tell me, don't tell me, don't tell me!  I'm saving it for after dinner!

speaker: Niles
text: Apparently Maris is going on a three-week cruise.  Her friends threw her a bon voyage party.  Look at the photo.  It's Maris on the arm of Pierson Broadwater.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, look!  She's just standing there, barely touching him, with only the tiniest bit of a smile on her face!

speaker: Niles
text: I know, you can practically hear the zing zing zing of her heartstrings!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sympathetically_] Oh, Dr Crane... [_goes to the kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it gets worse.  This morning I spoke to Marta, my ex-maid and current mole.  She reports that Broadwater is just the latest in a parade of escorts.  The gigolos are swarming around Maris like ants on a Snickers bar!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, wait a minute, that's good news.  If she's seeing a whole bunch of people, that means she's not serious about any one of them.

speaker: Niles
text: You think?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sure!  They're probably just her escorts.  You know how she loves going to parties.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and she never liked going anywhere alone.  Except to bed.

speaker: Martin
text: More good news.  And Niles, it wouldn't hurt you to go out a little bit every once in a while too.

speaker: Niles
text: If you're suggesting that I start dating, you can save your breath.  Women don't exactly find me irresistible.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, Niles, you've had lots of girlfriends.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, let's count.  There's Maris... oh no, Dora, my childhood pen pal from Costa Rica... I seem to recall a little girl in the fourth grade who lured me to a stairwell to show me her underpants.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, Niles, I think your problem is you still picture yourself as the same geeky kid you were in high school. But you've come a long way since then.  And you're not doing yourself any favours sitting home every night. Now just think about it. _Niles sinks back in the couch and whines pathetically.  Daphne enters from the kitchen with a bottle of wine in hand._

speaker: Daphne
text: Wine, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, wouldn't you? **HE WAS A BAND LEADER MARRIED TO CHARO**  _Scene Three - Apartment Daphne and Martin are going up in the lift. Eddie is on leash. Martin's a little frustrated after some park trauma._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, give it up, the man had every right to be proud of his dog.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I just don't like show-offs, OK? [_sarcastic_] "Ginger, catch the frisbee.  Ginger, roll over.  Ginger, do my taxes!"

speaker: Daphne
text: Just because Eddie's not good at tricks...

speaker: Martin
text: The hell he isn't!  He just likes the kind that gives him a chance to use his brain!  Eddie's a thinker!

speaker: Martin
text: Just watch this.  Open the door for him. [_Daphne does_] Now, I've been teaching him the names of all his chew toys. [_gives the command_] Eddie, get your banana.

speaker: Martin
text: Now he's thinking, "which one's the banana?" [_still not moving_] Now he's thinking, "what the heck did I do with my banana?"

speaker: Daphne
text: Now he's thinking, "which one's the emergency button?"

speaker: Martin
text: Come on! _Eddie scampers off, and follows Martin and Daphne into the apartment. Niles is standing in the living room with a glass of wine._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr Crane!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.  I let myself in, I hope that's all right.

speaker: Martin
text: Fine.  What's up?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I just stopped by to ask you a question.  Are you free Saturday night?

speaker: Martin
text: Sure!

speaker: Niles
text: [_gleefully_] Well, I'm not!  I have a date!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  Bravo, Dr. Crane!

speaker: Martin
text: Good for you!  Who is she?

speaker: Niles
text: Marjorie Nash, the "Fruit On The Bottom" yogurt heiress. I bumped into her at the Frye museum.  Before I knew it, your advice was thundering in my ears.  I found myself asking her out.  We'll be attending our club's annual winter dance, the "Snow Ball!"

speaker: Martin
text: Good for you!

speaker: Daphne
text: What's she like?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, she's terribly haughty and rumours persist about her husband's death.  But still, a date's a date!

speaker: Daphne
text: Snow Ball?  Sounds very glamourous.

speaker: Martin
text: I didn't know you could dance!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I can't.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear.  You don't think she'll want me to?  I've taken Maris to dozens of these things, she's never once asked to dance... of course, Maris dislikes public displays of rhythm. Oh, this is terrible!  My first date's a miserable failure before it even begins. [_reaches for his phone_] I'll just have to cancel.

speaker: Daphne
text: All you need are a few dancing lessons.  Why, I'd be happy to give you some.

speaker: Niles
text: You would?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah!  Growing up, I used to practise all the time with my brother Billy - the ballroom dancer?

speaker: Niles
text: I couldn't prevail upon you like that, it would be too much trouble. [_beat_] We'll have to move this!

speaker: Niles
text: OK, now push the chair back [_shoves ineffectively at it_] Or not. _Daphne drags it easily out of the way.  As they take their positions, Martin settles at the dinner table to watch them._

speaker: Daphne
text: Alright, we'll start with the box step.

speaker: Niles
text: Box step...

speaker: Daphne
text: It's very simple.  Take my hand like so, and your other hand goes around my waist. [_Niles does_] Now, start with your left foot.

speaker: Niles
text: OK, which one?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hush!  Step towards me, then bring your right foot forward-and-over, and slide the left over to meet it. Then the right foot goes back, the left back-and-over, and the right slides next to it.  And that's it!  All right, once again.  A one-two- [_he steps on her foot_] Oh!

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: -three, a two-two-three, a three-two-three, a four-two three...

speaker: Niles
text: [_struggling and staring at his feet_] This is boring yet difficult.

speaker: Martin
text: Aw, there's no trick to dancing.  It's just a matter of coordination. Hell, if you can ride a bike, or skip rope, or kick a ball, you can certainly...

speaker: Daphne
text: Alright, once again.  A one-two-[_he steps on her foot again_] Oh!-three...  _The scene FADES OUT...  Scene Four - Apartment ...and fades back in later on in the evening.  "Isn't It Romantic," is playing on the stereo and Niles and Daphne are dancing a slow waltz, with his head resting on her shoulder.  Niles seems to have gotten the hang of it._

speaker: Daphne
text: You're really doing very well, Dr. Crane.  Earlier you seemed a bit tense.  You've really relaxed now though, haven't you? _Cut to Niles's face: he's in a dream world of his own.  Martin comes in._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you two are looking pretty sharp.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I think we're ready to move on to the samba. [_to Eddie_] Eddie, fetch me a samba tape.  Xavier Cougat. [_Eddie just stares_] Now he's thinking, "the later Hollywood stuff, or the early New York recordings?" [_Niles and Daphne laugh_]

speaker: Martin
text: Now guess what I'm thinking.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll get it myself. [_runs off to her room_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_moving off_] Well, I'm going to hit the hay.

speaker: Niles
text: [_in a rhythm, he acts out his verbs_] Good-night -- bend-and- turn -- see-you-in-the-morning -- spin-and-dip -- [_cell phone rings_] there's-my-phone -- flip-and-push -- Niles-Crane. [_loses rhythm into the phone:_] Oh, Marjorie.  How are you? Oh, what a shame.  Well, er, no no it's alright, there'll be other dances.  No, no, I understand completely.  Take care. [_flips his phone shut_] Guess I won't be needing those dancing lessons.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sympathetically_] I guess not.  I'm sorry, son.

speaker: Daphne
text: I couldn't find any Cougie, but this'll do!

speaker: Daphne
text: Alright now, in the samba you have to hold me a little closer. You ready?  _She grabs his hand and starts moving back and forth against him, as if it were almost sexual._

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, there's one thing I wanted to mention...

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah?  [_dancing more against him_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_entranced_] I'm a dancer, a dancer dances!  _He sways with her with gusto.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **WHERE ELSE WOULD CORONERS GET TOGETHER?**  _Scene Five - Cafe Nervosa Niles is at a table, Martin & Daphne come towards him. Daphne and Niles greet each other with their "pet" names._

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's my dancing partner.  Hello, Fred!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Ginger!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Martin_] It's a little joke we have!

speaker: Niles
text: Look Daphne, I got two new CDs today.  Tonight we master the mambo and the conga.  I can feel myself growing a pencil-thin moustache just saying that.

speaker: Martin
text: You're having more lessons tonight?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes!  He's going to be the best dancer at the ball. I'll just go get us some coffees.

speaker: Martin
text: Why didn't you tell her your date had cancelled?  You don't need more lessons.

speaker: Niles
text: I wanted to, but she's just having so much fun!

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, Niles, you think I don't see the way you look at Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: What are you implying?

speaker: Martin
text: You know damn well what I'm implying.  Take my word for it, you're sticking a fork in the toaster here.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, my muffin's stuck!  Besides, what's the harm in a few dance lessons?

speaker: Martin
text: It's nighttime.  You're alone.  The music's on.  You've got your arms around her.  You'll end up saying something you can't take back.

speaker: Niles
text: I have no intention of saying anything.

speaker: Martin
text: No one ever does.  Take my word for it.  When I was separated from your mother, there was this pretty coroner in the city morgue.  I always had a bit of a crush on her.  So whenever we'd find a dead body, I'd yell out, "OK boys, I'll take it from here!"  So one night, I invited her down to the corner bar.

speaker: Niles
text: Coroners have their own bars?

speaker: Martin
text: [_exasperated_] No, _corner_ , Niles, the corner bar!  Anyway, we had a few drinks, the lights were low, Sinatra on the jukebox. Before I knew it, it just all came pouring out of me.  I told her how I felt.  I mean, I knew the second it was out of my mouth that it was a mistake.  She let me down easy but we still had to go on seeing each other all the time.  It sure was no fun going to the morgue after that! _This story seems to have the right effect on Niles.  Daphne returns to the table with coffees in hand._

speaker: Daphne
text: So, what time are we starting your lessons tonight, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, that won't be necessary.  I just got a call from Marjorie.  Something's come up.  I won't be going to the ball.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh.  Well, I'm sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: It's quite all right, and thank you for all your help. [_Martin puts a comforting arm on his shoulder_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_thoughtfully_] It seems such a shame to waste all that hard work... I hope you don't think I'm being too forward, but what would you say about _our_ going to the dance together?

speaker: Martin
text: Now, now, he's already taken up too much of your time, Daphne, he couldn't ask you to do that.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, but it would be as much fun for me as it would be for him! I'd love an elegant evening out!  What do you say, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Martin
text: [_sure Niles will say no_] Tell her what you say, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Pick you up at seven?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_excitedly_] Ooh, yes! [_claps her hands_] Great!  _Niles looks decidedly contented whilst Martin is appalled.  FADE TO:  Scene Six - Frasier's Apartment A few nights later, Eddie comes bounding in, handing Martin one of his chew toys._

speaker: Martin
text: No, Eddie that's not your banana, that's Mr. Pig.  Listen to the difference: pig, banana!  Pig, banana!  Pig, banana! [_Eddie shows no reaction_] Ah, I still love you, you little pinhead.  Go sit down.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh Frasier, am I glad you're back!  Listen, all sorts of....

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, please!  I have just spent the most wonderful six days with Frederick.  I am technically still on vacation till ten a.m. tomorrow.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but listen...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_waving off Martin's protests_] Bup-bup-bup-bup-bup!  Dad, I do not care to know how hard Daphne made you exercise, or about the boring foreign film Niles made you sit through, or about the progress of Eddie's on-again, off-again romance with the ottoman!

speaker: Martin
text: But you don't understand...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please!  For all intents and purposes, I am not here.  _The doorbell rings.  Daphne rushes out of her room in a ravishing red evening gown._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_excitedly_] That'll be my date! Ooh, I'm so excited, this is me first ball!  Oh, I hope he likes my dress...

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rushing by Frasier_] Hello, Dr. Crane, welcome back! _She opens the door to Niles, dressed in a tuxedo and carrying a red rose._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello!

speaker: Niles
text: [_captivated_] Wow!

speaker: Daphne
text: Ohhh, [_giggles_] you! [_takes the rose_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_mystified_] Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier, you're back! [_to Daphne_] Well, our carriage awaits.

speaker: Martin
text: And you'd better get her home at a decent hour, I'm gonna be waiting up for you!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_] Oh, Mr. Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_dumbstruck_] What the hell was that?

speaker: Martin
text: [_looking around curiously_] Eddie, did you hear sumpin'? [_heads off towards the kitchen_] Can't be Frasier, he's still on vacation!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_following Martin doggedly_] Dad, what was that?  Dad, will you stop kidding around?  Was that a date?  Dad! _FADE TO:  Scene Seven - Ballroom And so, Niles and Daphne, arrive at the elegant "Snow Ball." Soft romantic music is being played by the orchestra as the Beautiful couple enter._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, it's so beautiful!

speaker: Niles
text: Just for tonight, could you call me Niles?

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, when I was at school I knew a boy named Niles. I called him Niley.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pause_] Just for tonight, could you call me Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: You're a vision... everyone's staring at you!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you look awfully handsome yourself... Niles. [_sniggers_]

speaker: Niles
text: Would you like some champagne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that would be lovely.

speaker: Niles
text: Be back in a moment. _He goes to the bar.  A haughty woman, Lacey, and her husband, Andrew, are standing there._

speaker: Niles
text: Two champagnes, _tout de suite._

speaker: Lacey
text: Niles, dear! How _are_ you!

speaker: Niles
text: Just fine, thanks.

speaker: Lacey
text: Andrew, say hello to Niles.

speaker: Andrew
text: Haven't seen you for ages.  Feel just terrible about you and Maris.

speaker: Lacey
text: Oh yes, we were just devastated.  Positively _everyone's_ talking about it.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, and how is positively everyone?

speaker: Lacey
text: Devastated.  We were just saying that to Maris, when we ran into her and Bradley Paxton at the Breever's Cup.

speaker: Andrew
text: No, she was with Calvin Oldi at the Breever's Cup.

speaker: Lacey
text: Well, it's so hard to keep track anyway. [_laughs_] Niles, if there's anything we can do to cheer you up?  Just let us know...

speaker: Niles
text: [_muttering to himself_] Perhaps a murder-suicide pact.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_takes their champagnes from the bartender_] Well, they weren't very nice!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, everyone in our set seems to have this idea that while Maris is out living the high life, I'm sitting at home, crushed and lonely.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, well, never mind those gossipy twits.  Tonight, you're all mine. [_puts the glasses on the table and opens her arms_] Now take me in your arms, Niles, and let the music carry us away... _She leads him out onto the dance floor and just as they assume the right position, the conductor turns around._

speaker: Conductor
text: Thank you, we'll be back in ten minutes. _Sheepish, Daphne and Niles join in the light applause.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Eight Ten minutes' later: Niles & Daphne are waltzing together. As the music ends, he dips her._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_] I can't remember when I've had a better time. I'm on Cloud Nine!

speaker: Niles
text: I'd have to look down to see Cloud Nine! [_leads her back to the table_] Daphne, I must tell you again, that is an exquisite gown.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thanks! It was way out of my price range, but did you ever see something and say, "I just have to have it?"  _Niles cannot help but gaze longingly at her.  Then, out of breath, he starts to sit down._

speaker: Niles
text: Where's my chair? _The orchestra begins a tango just as Niles sinks into his chair thankfully._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_gasps_] A tango! [_stands and grabs his hand_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you never taught me a tango!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you'll love it!  It's perfect for you!  This is a passionate, full-blooded dance that rose up from the slums of Buenos Aires.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the parallels between me and an unemployed _gaucho_ aside, I think we probably should just sit this one out.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, nonsense!  There's only one rule in the tango: our bodies must be in continuous contact, with not a sliver of daylight between us. [_she presses her body close to his_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_overwhelmed_] I can do that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Stop!  Don't be afraid!  Daphne won't let anything happen to you.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't think-

speaker: Daphne
text: [_grabs his face_] Don't think!  Just feel. [_holds his lapels and seductively pulls him forward_] You're an Argentine slum- dweller.  You have no house, no car, you don't know where your next meal is coming from.  But none of that matters. Because tonight... [_they join hands and cast their eyes toward some imaginary moon_] we have the tango!

speaker: Niles
text: [_dips her; in an Argentine accent_] Oh mama, I've got it all!  _They proceed to cross the dance floor in an eye-catching tango step. The conductor notices them and smiles._

speaker: Daphne
text: That's it!  You're dazzling!  You're brilliant! But I feel you're holding back!

speaker: Niles
text: I am.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, this is no time for inhibitions!

speaker: Niles
text: I know.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh. let it out Niles. Let everything out!

speaker: Niles
text: [_passionately_] Oh Daphne, I adore you! _He spins around so he can't see her and slaps a hand to his mouth in shock.  Oops.  He spins back around to face her._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_eyes closed in rapture_] I adore you too!

speaker: Niles
text: What?!?!?

speaker: Daphne
text: I adore you too.

speaker: Niles
text: [_thrilled_] Oh, how I've longed to hear those words!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, how I've longed to say them!

speaker: Niles
text: You're beautiful!  You're a goddess!

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't ever want this moment to end!

speaker: Niles
text: Then let's not let it! _By now everyone is watching them and the music is nearing its end. He spins her back and forth across the floor, a passionate whirlwind. He spins her again, and this time she throws her bare leg up on his shoulder.  Angle on Andrew and Lacey's table: Andrew is openly gawping at Daphne, while an upstaged Lacey does her best to look indifferent.  The music swells to a crescendo, Daphne slides down to position herself next to Niles's thighs, and Niles grips his own lapels like a knight- errant.  The music ends.  Applause.  He pulls her to her feet._

speaker: Niles
text: This is the most glorious night of my life.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, mine too...   [_N.B. Niles and Daphne will not kiss for another four years, at the end of Season Seven._] _As they break apart, Niles gives a sly look to Lacey & Andrew as if to say "Ha! I bet Maris hasn't done this!"  He leads her back to the table.  Daphne is now constantly throwing glances over her shoulder. They sit, and Niles caresses her hand._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne!  I'm a new man!  Do you have any idea what I'm feeling?

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course I do!  Your friends look positively dumbstruck. From now on there'll be no more of that "oh poor Niles" attitude...

speaker: Niles
text: Far from it! _He kisses her hand reverently; she looks over her shoulder then turns back to him._

speaker: Daphne
text: I knew you were a good dancer, but I had no idea you were such a good actor!

speaker: Niles
text: [_shocked_] Actor?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah!  "Daphne, you're a goddess, Daphne, I adore you..." We fooled everyone, didn't we?

speaker: Niles
text: [_heartbroken_] Oh...oh.  We certainly did, didn't we? [_lets go of her hand_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm surprised it was so easy!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, given the right circumstances, anyone can be fooled.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh!  What do you say to another dance?

speaker: Niles
text: No thanks, it's getting late and I've danced enough.

speaker: Daphne
text: Alright, then!  I'll just go powder my nose and then we'll be off. _She leaves; Niles sinks down into his chair, dejected.  A blonde woman who has been watching Niles comes over._  Claire: Niles? [_he turns_] No, no, please.  Claire Barnes?  I was an associate in your attorney's office.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, Claire.  Uh, it's good to see you again. Claire: Well, I heard about you and Maris.  And I just wanted to give you my card and tell you you're free to call me anytime.

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking it_] Oh, thank you, but I'm happy with my attorney. Claire: I meant to go dancing. _Niles looks up, surprised.  She nods and gives him a warm, come-hither smile.  As she moves off, Daphne comes back._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, are you ready?

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking at the card_] No, I don't think I am. [_drops it on the table_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Niles
text: Er, I mean yes.  Uh, let's go.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, we certainly had fun tonight, didn't we?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing wryly_] We certainly did.

speaker: Daphne
text: And to think you almost didn't come to the ball!  You know, it's such a shame when people let fear stop them from trying new things.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pauses and removes Daphne's arm from his_] Excuse me. _Turning back to the table, he picks up the card, puts it in his jacket pocket, returns to Daphne's side and offers his arm.  He smiles._

speaker: Niles
text: I'm ready now. _They leave.  The music swells up again, as Miss "Cinderella" Moon and Mr. "Handsome Prince" Crane gracefully exit the ball room along with an experience to last for a life time: "Moon Dance"  END OF ACT TWO_
